event.name: AEA_SHARD_CRYSTAL_KNICKNACKS
event.text: A Crystalline market is established here, a rare sight. It appears to have drawn a large crowd, and is selling Crystal relics. There's also a ship outfitting store towards the back of the market.
You find a wide variety of items inside the market, from ancient crystal cutlery to rare crystalline weapons.

choice.text: Check out the merchant selling ancient household items.

event.text: Most of the items are useless to you, but one item stands out to you. Towards the back sits a strange item, the merchant explains that it's an ancient cooling unit, its possible you could use it to enhance your weapons system.
You install the cooling unit into your weapons system.

choice.text: Check out the merchant selling rare crystal weapons.

event.text: It appears the merchant has sold out of the most of the smaller weapons and so only a few ship based weapons remain.

choice.text: Buy the Elite Crystal Burst MK I. [80~]

event.text: You pay the merchant and take the weapon back to your ship.
You pay the merchant and take the weapon back to your ship.
You ignore the market.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_BAR
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover a rowdy bar full of Shard-Forged Pirates.

As you enter the bar, you attract the attention of a pair of pirates sitting in the corner. You notice one of them talking to the other while pointing you out. Eventually you make your way over to them. "You're a captain right? working with the federation? We recently lost the rest of our crew when we were attacked by a rebel ship, we were wondering if you would be interested in taking us both on for a small fee."
You welcome them onboard before getting ready to leave.
You spend some time at the bar before returning to your ship, theres still some time to do something before you need to leave.
You ignore the bar.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_ARGUMENT
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to immediately have your ears assaulted as your comms pickup an argument going down between two Shard-Forged captains.

"Listen here, you had NO right to go telling that story when it was ME who found the space whales, NOT YOU!" "WE FOUND THOSE WHALES TOGETHER, We're BOTH allowed to tell the space whale stpry." The first captain, finally noticing you, responds. "Well, how about this renegade decide, was it MY story to tell becuase I found them, or should he get to tell the story just becuase he showed up late."

choice.text: "It was the first guy's story to tell. Finders keepers."

event.text: "Thank you, SEE, the renegade says I'm right." Responds the 1st captain. The 2nd captain grumbles some complaints before flying away. The 1st captain turns his attention back to you. "As a token of my appreciation for your support, have some of these supplies."

choice.text: "Well, since you were both there you should both get to tell it."

event.text: "Thank you, SEE, the renegade says I'm right." Responds the 2nd captain. The 1st captain grumbles some complaints before flying away. The 2nd captain turns his attention back to you. "As a token of my appreciation for your support, have some of these supplies."

choice.text: "It should have been ONLY the second guy's story to tell."

event.text: "What! He didn't even find the whales! Alright, Screw you!" The first captain, outraged at your response activates his weapons and turns them on you. The 2nd ship takes the opportunity to run away.
"Alright forget it." The first captain flies away, disinterested in continuing the argument.
You activate your weapons and prepare to fight.
You wait for the FTL drive to charge.
You cut off their comms frequency and wait for the FTL drive to charge.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_DRUNK
event.text: A Shard-Forged ship accosts you. "Hey! You... jerk!" The owner of the ship seems to be intoxicated. "This whooooole war thing. This is your fault! Yoooouuu... Renegade. None of this rebellion woulda happened if it wasn't for... you know... the Federation being dumb and slow. Now my business is slumping because yooooou and your multiversal war are getting in the way!"

choice.text: (Nights) "Your businesssss isss failing becausssse you SSSSUCK."

event.text:
The drunk tries to respond, but before he can, Nights cuts him off. "Oh, you're jusssst failing becausssse the timessss are bad, it'ssss not your fault? Let me guessss, before the Rebelssss it wassss your wife. Or maybe your competitor did ssssomething unfair? Sssshut up, you're jusssst a failure. Own it."
"But I... but you..." The man tries desperately to counter Nights, but he falters. The sound of stumbling footsteps can be heard as one of the other pirates on the ship tends to the comms. "Well, I think you did us all a favor for that. Why don't we just give you this and we'll both be on our way?"

choice.text: Engage him with a well reasoned debate.

event.text: You explain to him the importance of your mission, but he completely dismisses all of your well-formulated arguments with the standard variety of fallacies. You politely attempt to inform him of his fallacious reasoning, but for some strange and unknowable reason, this doesn't get through to the angry drunk pirate. You realise this is leading nowhere and leave the ship and its rants behind.
You engage in a tiring shouting match with the guy. Eventually, something that you say strikes a nerve. He attacks!

choice.text: Threaten to blow his ship to pieces.
Actually blow his ship to pieces.

event.text: "AND THERE IT IS! Look everyone, I'm being repressed!" The Shard-Forged ship returns fire!
The ship continues to broadcast nasty words at you, but you pay it no mind.
"Whoa whoa, calm down man! I didn't mean nothing by it, we're all friends here! See, friends!" The Shard-Forged ship tosses a weapon out of the hold and keeps its distance from you.
"Oh you wanna go? You wanna go? I can take you!" The Shard-Forged ship preempts you by attacking first!
"Well uh... you know uh... I would totally kick your ass, but I have too much work to do. So there." The ship quickly disengages.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_TERRITORY
event.text: As you arrive you're immediately greeted by a Shard-Forged ship, "Oi, This is our territory, you better clear off or we'll have some strong words for you."
The Pirate seems confused for a moment before doubling down. "Yeah, Well we don't believe you, That's just what a rebel spy would say! Now clear off."

choice.text: "No, we're not a rebel spy, look at our federation clearance."

event.text: "That's exactly what a rebel spy would have! PREPARE TO DIE REBEL SCUM!"
You move a safe distance away and wait for the FTL drive to charge.
You move a safe distance away and wait for the FTL drive to charge.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_BIG_PILE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon and begin scanning the surroundings, theres a planet nearby with a strange structure on it, it appears to be a large pyramid of some sort, but you can't make out more than that.
You arrive at what you now realize is a massive pile of junk, and you are greeted by a strange old crystal. "Ah, traveller, welcome to the horde, please feel free to make a donation to the pile."

You throw your scrap onto the pile, watching it shift and stir as it settles into place. Just as you think it's finished, the pile shifts again and a weapon rises to the surface. You notice that there's still a large amount of scrap on the surface, you could just take it back, although that seems like it could anger whatever this is.

choice.text: Steal back some of your scrap.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_PILE_PUNISH
event.text: You begin scooping up the scrap and taking in back onboard your ship. Just as you think you're getting away with it the stolen scrap explodes, destroying any scrap near it. A moment later you detect a Shard-Forged ship reveal it self nearby. Prepare for a fight.

You throw your scrap onto the pile, watching it shift and stir as it settles into place. Just as you think it's finished, the pile shifts again and a weapon rises to the surface. You notice that there's still a large amount of scrap on the surface, you could just take it back, although that seems like it could anger whatever this is.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_PILE_IGNORE
event.text: You move a safe distance away and wait for the FTL drive to charge.

event.name: DISTRESS_AEA_SHARD_SHUTTLE
event.text: The origin of the distress call is a small Shard-Forged shuttle being chased by a slaver. They don't have many means to defend themselves.
The slaver switches targets the moment you draw near. "Another juicy target! So be it!"

choice.text: Wait for the slaver to catch their quarry.

event.text: You graciously wait for the slaver to conduct their business. Once they do, the slaver hails you. "You're a patient one. I take it you want to do business with us, then?"
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"Okay then. If you say so...?" Weirded out, the Slaver leaves.
You don't bother getting mixed up in this situation. Your uninvolvement will ensure that nobody will think better or worse of you.

surrender.text: "We surrender! Take one of our slaves as tribute; if you destroy us they'll all die anyway!"

destroyed.text: The slave ship is destroyed. They won't continue their evil trade, but many lives were probably lost on that ship.

event.text: "We thought since it looked like a Mantis ship, they might be friendly... nope. Pirate ship. They even got some of us before you saved us. Well, here's a gratuity for saving us."

deadCrew.text: Once the fighting stops, your attention is brought to the ship's brig - a Shard-Forged asks to go back.

choice.text: Bring them back to their ship.

event.text: "We thought since it looked like a Mantis ship, they might be friendly... nope. Pirate ship. Thanks for rescuing our crew member. We won't forget this."

event.name: AEA_SHARD_RIVAL_SHIP
event.text: You arrive at the beacon and are greeted by a Shard-Forged ship. It appears to be hailing you.

"Renegade, we were wondering if we could temporarily hire you for a job. Theres a group of Tiiikaka slavers causing problems for us, they've already stolen one of our stations. We need you to go and hunt down their ship, aswell as deal with the stolen station, we'll pay extra if you get the station back without blowing it up."
"Excellent, We'll send you the coordinates for both."
"And heres the coordinates for the station."
You move a safe distance away and wait for the FTL drive to charge.
You activate your weapons and prepare to attack.
You move a safe distance away and wait for the FTL drive to charge.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_RIVAL_SHIP_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The last known location of the Tiiikaka ship you've been hired to destroy.

event.text: You arrive at the beacon to find the Tiiikaka ship. They notice you aswell and move in to attack.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_RIVAL_STATION_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the stolen station you've been hired to clear, or atleast destroy.

event.text: You arrive at the beacon to find the stolen station. They notice you aswell and activate their weapons in preparation of your attack.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_TIIIKAKA_NEXT
event.text: You'll need to head to the other location the pirates gave you to finish the job.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_TIIIKAKA_FINISHED
event.text: Eventually the pirates that hired you show up. They hail you and thank you for getting the job done.
"We've increased your pay as you saved the station, good work." The ship transfered the payment before going off to recover the station.
"It's unfortunate that you didn't save the way, regardless good work." The ship transfered the payment before going off to recover the remains of the station.

event.name: FLOATING_CARGO_AEA_SHARD
event.text: Not too far from the beacon, you detect a destroyed cargo ship with its cargo scattered nearby, intact.

choice.text: Leave it alone, this looks suspicious.

event.text: You leave the cargo alone and prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Run an advanced scan on the boxes.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Run an advanced scan on the boxes.
(Slug Crew) Have your Slug check the boxes.
(Telepathic Shell) Have your Shell check the boxes.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_HOSTILE_SHIP
event.text: Out of nowhere, a Shard-Forged ship jumps in, guns blazing. You don't know why they're attacking, but you have no choice but to engage.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_ASTEROID
event.text: The asteroid field here isn't the only hazard at this beacon. The Shard-Forged ship here trying to hide doesn't give you a chance and immediately attacks!

event.name: AEA_SHARD_PALACE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a large force of Shard-Forged ships outside the palace, unusually they're not turned to face you, but the palace instead.
You land nearby and walk over to the palace, there are a few Shard-Forged around, but none of them do more than glance at you, most seem more concerned with the ships overhead.

As you enter the palace you're once again met with no resistance, you make your way towards the center and eventually arrive in a large hall, you can make out a number of Shard-Forged around a table in the center of the room.
A moment later the odd looking Shard-Forged at the head of the table notices you. "Who goes there?" His voice booms across the room. "Are you that federation renegade we've been hearing about?"

"It is concerning that you got in here without being stopped, however you may have just arrived at the perfect time. You may have seen our problem outside, one of the stronger Shard-Forged clans has come to challenge my reign, they wish to take the dawnshard and take control of the Shard-Forged."

"That means they must kill me and take it from my body, would you be willing to sneak me onboard your ship, I can join your crew and let my Generals sort out this situation? The various members of the clan above will be far less willing to go to war if capturing the dawnshard is out of the question."

"Excellent, I shall conceal myself in this large coat as we leave, hopefully the ships above won't trouble themselves with us." You head back outside towards your ship, you make it into your ship and it appears none of the ships above notice. It's only once you begin to take off that one of the large ships off to the side moves into block your path. It appears to be jamming your FTL drive, preventing you from leaving.
The King seems disapointed, but respects your decisions. As you're taking off from where you landed a smaller Shard-Forged ship moves out to block your path.

choice.text: This isn't what we expected. Leave.

event.text: You ignore whatever is going down at the palace and prepare your FTL drive.

event.name: DESTROYED_AEA_SHARD_BOSS
event.text: The large Shard-Forged ship falls to your weapons and you regain the ability to jump. With the defeat of such a strong vessel the other Shard-Forged ships keep their distance, wary of you. You're able to scrap the remains.
The King comes up to you. "Good work back there, I was meaning to give this to you, its the blueprints for a Shard-Forged Auto-Cruiser. You should send it onto the federation."

event.name: AEA_SHARD_AUTO_START
event.text: You've arrived in an asteroid field, the remains of a Shard-Forged cruiser sit nearby.
You search the wreck of the ship but find no signs of life, you scrap the wreckage while you wait for your FTL drive to charge.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_AUTO_AMBUSH
event.text: Just as you're about to leave a massive autoship appears from inside the asteroid field rushing towards you, you're only just able to get to the battlestations in time.

choice.text: This isn't what we expected. Leave.

event.text: You back off to a safe distance and prepare your FTL drive.

event.name: ESCAPE_AEA_SHARD_AUTO
event.text: You see a crack form down the sides of one of the crystals on the auto ship. You see more and more form before the crystal parts of the ship explode clouding your sensors. By the time you can see again the ship has jumped away. Luckily whatever the ship used to cloud it's escape has left a visible trail in the direction the ship jumped, you're able to use this to telegraph the beacon it likely jumped to.

event.name: AEA_SHARD_AUTO_QUEST
event.text: This time there is no asteroid field, however it appears the auto-ship is still recovering from your fight. As it senses you it activates it's weapons again.

event.name: DESTROYED_AEA_SHARD_AUTO
event.text: The Auto ship finally crumbles apart, massive chunks of crystal shattering in it's final explosions. You begin searching the remains of the ship. You find a lot of scrap, but more importantly you're able to access the mostly intact databanks of the ship.

Inside the database you find the plans for a mutiny at the palace, it seems whoever was giving this ship orders is trying to kill the Dawnshard's bearer and take it for themselves. Alongside those plans you find a blueprint for a large Shard-Forged cruiser.
